name: Reina Beatdown
description: Based on Anatomy of Anarchy, I felt that Legwork was more useful in this case than Indexing.

name: Tenma Industrial
description:
Amazon Industrial Zone goes on a central. I favor R&D.

Tenma Line goes in an unprotected remote.

Early game, AIZ enables those Komainu or Tsurugi to cost 2c or 3c, respectively, in line with your now 0-1c Wall of Static/Bastion suite. Your 1c Quandries and Pups pull triple duty between early protection against runs, Parasite bait to spare a Komainu or Tsurugi, or as unrezzed mystery dick-cards to screw with Kit decks or just force people to pull out a Code Gate just for Quandries.

All the ICE is still cheap enough that without the AIZ draw, you can still afford to rez them; they're all taxing, so even if they aren't in optimal order, you won't be letting the runner through cheap, and 2-deep on all centrals is a good place to be anyway so that you can mix and match with Tenma.

Some of your ICE will still be unrezzed since the core combo of install on remote unrezzed > install on AIZ > third click to swap the two pieces will leave some unrezzed. As a result, Escher hurts much less than you'd think; you know the board state at any given time, the runner doesn't, and only you can fully alter it.

There are 10 agendas, all 2-pointers. Philotic is a perfect 1-off for this. Fetals pair with your net damage to make early game baited traps. Fetals flatline early game when behind a Komainu. Waiting to drop in the Fetal until you either have the 2 desired ICE in hand, or at least installing the ICE first then install-advance-advance the next turn, is pretty taxing on the runner early. Transforming a blown-up Sundew remote into a Komainu-Fetal bomb subtly via Tenma Line is a wonderful thing.

Assets get used as feints, but like everything else in this deck get used as the situation calls for. PAD Campaigns generally go down unprotected to draw the tempo hit. Sundews get installed only when they can be protected; they are by no means required, but they supercharge this deck by giving you a free 2/4/6c every turn. Good runners WILL prioritize blowing them up, so make it expensive so that the runner has to decide between unprotected rezzed PAD Campaigns, protected Sundews, unprotected unrezzed AIZs as standalone remotes (which may be traps to the runner's eye) with SanSan cities both as a unprotected standalone and a 2+ deep iceberg.

Medical Breakthroughs are used to bait/force the runner to panic. You almost WANT the runner to have Medical Breakthroughs. Once one of them is scored/stolen, you can score the remaining 2 out of hand off a SanSan grid or you can leave it in your standalone remote farm for a turn before you score it, maybe while deploying a protected Sundew as well.

name: CoolBox Kate
description: and odd deck i am trying out. any suggestion small tricks would be great, possibly building this up for local tournaments, and i just wanted to try something new (i usually play Criminal)

name: Kate Event Toolbox
description: Get into any servers fast

name: Jinteki Modernism v1.0
description:
This deck is my attempt at a Jinteki interpretation of the Supermodernism archetype.

The general principle remains the same. Bully the runner into running slowly through a credible flatline threat. Exploit a slow runner by advancing agendas out, exploit a reckless runner through a flatline. However, there are two main advantages I find in the Jinteki variation.

1) ICE can threaten a flatline. Supermodernism ice typically is not very threatening outside of archer. The Jinteki ice is generally a lot more damaging and distruptive. A Chum+Komainu can end a careless runner. Though this rarely happens in practice the net effect is that unrezed ice is very threatening. Even after getting a sentry breaker, Inazuma keeps the threat alive until the runner has a full breaker suite.

2) All agendas are self defending. One of the weaknesses of Supermodernism is leaking early points out of R&D through a series of lucky/unlucky accesses. While it is still possible for the Jinteki version to leak points, every agenda stolen is taxing to the runner and serves as a deterrent to further runs. Multi-access (which is quite popular in today's meta with Legwork and Maker's Eye) is also quite dangerous against this deck and can easily lead to a flatline.

Some notable synergies present:

ID + Punitive Counterstrike + Neural EMP can turn a stolen agenda (especially a Fetal AI) into a flatline with very little credits.

Chump + Pup is excellent defense for very little money.

Komainu is a rockstar in this deck. Relatively cheap to rez, very taxing to break, very disruptive/dangerous if unbroken.

name: NEXT Designers, Make It Work, Tim Gunn.
description:
"Designers. Make it work. Tim Gunn." -Leslie Knope (doing her impression of Tim Gunn)

Rationale

This is an attempt to make NEXT Design: Guarding the Net work, like how Tim Gunn makes designs work.

ICE and ICE Density

ICE makes up half of the deck to support the identity and also, the Accelerated Beta Tests. Beta Testing into big ICE is so fun. Since the NEXT Bronze, NEXT Silver, and Mother Goddess go well together, those won't hurt too.

Economy

Click the Melange Mining Corp. or live off sexy male model adverts for money early with the ICE advantage. But it may not be enough to rez big ICE sustainably, hence Oversight AI.

Put your Pop-up Windows over R&D to encourage runs on a low agenda density deck and pray they don't get 3 pointers. Haha!

Disclaimer

Obviously experimental, but it looks fun, and that's what Netrunner is all about! Right? I think.

Shoutout to ashtaroth's interns here for the number crunching! Interesting read too. Check it out!

name: TRACERT -j  root.hack.r
Any publicity is good publicity!
Tennin' the herd
Bioroid Action Corp
Vulnerability 101
Demolition Man
sKate
Do you wanna build a Katman
description:
This is my version of the katman deck that has been going around.

Card choices:

got rid of the anarch breakers since I should be focusing on the atmans anyway.

Picked up sharpshooter for big destroyers.

extra clone chip for recursion.

Legwork for HQ pressure.

Notes: always have more money than the corp!

name: Bioroid Supremacy
description:
Asset based economy supported by Encryption Protocol.

Captialize on synergy between all the bioroid ICE and Stronger Together, Tyr's Hand, Project Wotan, and Bioroid Efficiency Research. I've considered including Howler for some recursion, but Project Vitruvius should fulfill the same role.

The Reclamation Order is intended for the Adonis Campaigns or GRNDL Refineries; use them early and which ever has three in Archives first can be pulled.

name: Tag n Bad v1.1
description: Dropped snare for more efficient ETR. Dropped tollbooth for lotus field. Added an Archived memories for recursion.

name: REGIONALS RUNNER DEUTSCHLAND
REGIONALS Deutschland
description: Old decklist of the deck that was used in the regionals in germany

name: Shape of a Criminal v4.0
description: So...I took Pinkwarrior's advice and replaced Doppleganger with Desperado. I'm also considering taking the Maker's Eyes and Legworks out and putting the more permanent options (Interfaces) in their place. Anyone have any thoughts on that prospect?

name: Can somebody bring me a FSCKING card table???
description:
INTENSE SHELL GAMES

Bring this to your game night and reserve a row of tables. 3 card monte everywhere. I know, it should run ToL, but whatever. This is just for laughs.

name: Ian Stirling
Walking on the moon
description: Drip Economy and strong tag punish. Psychographics to a market research or a PSF.

name: Replicating Contacts & MO
description:
Ive always wanted to make a deck around this special shaper. This is my thoughts of how it might work.

The idea behind this deck is to have as much MU as possible to charge Overmind. Replicator will help thin the deck tutoring all hardware duplicates and triplicates. Diesel and Quality Time will boost card draw. Basic economy revolves around MO & Professional Contacts.

Initial hand MUST have MO or PC. After that You will either 3-click MO or 3-Click PC or even instal 3 cards, for a extra click (Identities ability). With two clicks available you will be able to run agressively or play events.

In theory, this should work :)

name: Kids Hate the News
description:
With the NBN AstroTrain stomping on runners all over Louisville I decided to move away from my beloved Kate and slip into something a little faster on the draw.

Initially, I used Gordian Blade as the "Oh it's a bunch of STR 5 code gates" answer, but I decided to add a third Test Run and Scavenge into the mix to try to get all my high powered breakers like Femme and Torch on the board on the cheap.

name: Relentless
description:
Based on Steven Wooley's Anatomy of Anarchy.

The idea behind this deck is to punch through their ice just a few times using expensive, but flexible breakers (Knight and Overmind). Make those runs count with Account Siphon, Crescentus, and Keyhole. Face-checking ice early with Rook will slow the Corp down enough to get a Knight or Overmind out and threaten R&D/HQ. Additionally, you'll see a tag-me strategy with Joshua B, Data Leak Reversal and a bunch of Plascretes. I usually throw down Joshua pretty early (but you have to read the game carefully before taking a bunch of tags).

You might notice that I don't have any recursion. In my testing I didn't need it because a) I run 3 of all my key cards and b) I can usually hamstring the Corp (and many times win) by the mid-game.

I also found that Parasite, even without Datasuckers, is really good. It makes quick enough work of strength 2 or less ice and it saves you 1 credit/turn to break with Overmind.

name: Jinteki RP Genesis
description: Core Set with Genesis Cycle only. The point is to confuse opponent to lose money trying to see what is installed. Always defends whatever it is, agenda or asset, for additional confuse. Do not try to win with scoring agendas, kill opponent with net damage from Project Junebug or Ronin. Keep Snares in hands.

name: Next Design Genesis
description: Core Set and Genesis Cycle only. Open Janus with Oversight AI, make money with Melange and fast advance agendas. Bonus tricks are Project Junebug and Secretary.

name: Kit Genesis
description: Core Set and Genesis Cycle only (except Rielle "Kit" Peddler, of course). Classic Yog.0 + Dinosaurus combo. Use Parasites and Datasuckers to lower the strength for Yog.0 and use Crypsis for other Ices.

name: Weyland - Waste Managment
description: Program destruction, latest iteration.

name: Weyland - Waste Mgmt
description: My take on program destruction. Thx for comments.

name: Hall of Pain
description: This is something I put together after playing several different variations of Jinteki, which has been my faction of choice since I started playing Netrunner. The basic theme is: "In how many ways can I hurt the Runner?"

name: Semi-Fast Advance
IT'S A TRAP
description: ALL THE NET DAMAGE

name: Puny Brains
description: Corp deck for the San Antonio Regionals. My first tourney, came in 13th out of 40 something. Every Corp win I had was a flatline. This deck is at its best when the runner takes an early brain damage, then can sit back and wait for an opportunity for Punitive Counterstrike and/or Neural EMP. Inazuma helps lock runners into brain damage and keeps exposed, breakable ice dangerous. Main peril is if the runner steals multiple agendas in a single turn when you're not ready to counter, and just in general there's clearly still much tweaking to be done, but overall has served me well.

name: Peddling Forgeries
description: Runner deck for San Antonio Regionals. First tourney, came in 13th out of 40 something. A Yogasaurus Kit using FAO, Paintbrush, and Tinkering to run run run. Indexing the most effective route to agendas, Escher to make optimal run paths. Econ needs adjusting. I threw in the Dirty Laundries at the last second to limited success. Pondering a version that uses Omega.

name: SA Core Haas Bioroid
Kids Hate the News 2.0
description:
With the AstroTrain leaving NBN so capable of getting up and gone before most runners can get off their feet, I decided it was time to abandon the warm comforts of Ms. McCaffrey and play something with a little more get up and go. Get the rig out, print some money, and trample over the puny servers protecting SanSan.

Because of the prevalence of Quandary, but also of strength 5 code gates, I wanted some flexibility in choosing what was more appropriate by game, giving Zu to not waste Stimhack dollars, or Torch if Inazuma and Tollbooth pay a visit.

name: No Idea What I'm Doing
Noise - ICE Killer
description: One of the first decks I ever made, this one was pretty successful. The idea is to abuse the Parasite Datasucker combo as much as possible. People will often leave their archives unguarded, so pick up a whole bunch of Datasucker tokens by running for free on archives. Bishop, Rook, and Pawn create a formidable Caissa suite that complements Parasite extremely well, and Nerve Agent and Medium let you shift your focus if either R&D or HQ are too well protected.

name: Poe both wrote on them
description:
How is a raven like a writing desk?

is the riddle from Alice in Wonderland that is also on theophilius bagbiter.

the answer to the riddle is that Edgar Allen Poe both wrote on them. The desk in the literal sense, the raven in the sense that writing on something is another way of saying writing about something
